intro: Malacothrix torreyi, commonly known as the Torrey's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Malacothrix torreyi plays a role in supporting local pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
